intro: Hebenstretia holubii, commonly known as the Holub's hebenstretia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. Hebenstretia holubii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
